utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: This afternoon, I'm just here because I've been experiencing some breathlessness as well as a bit of cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, when did it start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I think it's a it started around three months ago and I believe it's just been getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, how often are you experiencing the shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I feel it like a lot of the time, especially outside when I'm in the cold or at at night when I go outside at night, my chest feels a little tight too at the same time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how long does it last?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say it lasts up to an hour every time I'm out in the cold and then once I come back in. So I'd say it lasts at least one hour.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, does anything else make it worse, like dust? You know, laying down anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sometimes when I'm near dust, sometimes when I'm running during gym class, increased activity does make it worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. And if you were to describe the quality of your breathing difficulties, is it more like a burning kind of feeling? Is it like you can't catch your breath? What does it feel like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think it's more just a I can't catch my breath and it feels like my my throat is just kind of like closing off and I can't take deep breaths.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, that's scary. And one to 10, 10 being the worst, how bad is your shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It can get up to I would say like an 8 at times. It can get pretty scary. And sometimes, like I feel like heaviness in my chest too when it happens.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, and the coughing, has it been going on for as long as your breathlessness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say around the same same time frame like 3 months, but I'm not always coughing. It comes and goes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and for your coughing, is it kind of like the same triggers, the cold, dust, things like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you ever have do you ever cough up blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't. It's mostly just a dry cough. I don't cough up anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK so no sputum or phlegm, no? OK, do you ever feel wheezy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I I do hear like a like a weird sound when I breathe out sometimes, I I think it might be wheeziness.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Do you have a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no I don't have a sore throat, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Um, how about a runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no changes in my smell, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How about hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no hearing is fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and like no pus or liquid's coming out of your ear or anything like that, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No ear pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about your vision, everything OK there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, everything is OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know about a fever, I haven't checked, but some nights I do, especially in the last week I have woken up feeling a bit chilly. I haven't really checked.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you woke up feeling chilly, any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about changes in your skin? Like have you noticed a rash anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, not that I've really noticed no, no rashes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and any chest pain at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just sometimes when I I'm coughing a lot I feel a little bit of just tension and heaviness in there. But that's just when I'm like really coughing a lot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah OK, and any any feelings like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK. And how about swelling? Have you noticed swelling anywhere in your body?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK um, OK, how about um, does your shortness of breath get worse when you're falling asleep?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that. I think it's mainly just worse if I go out in the cold or I'm like running around, doing more activities.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Does it ever wake you up at night?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No never.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no nausea or vomitting.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about changes in your in your bowel movement?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, bowel movements are normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about in terms of urinating, any changes there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Any dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Confusion, memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good are you otherwise healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I don't have any other condition, I I do remember my doctors saying I have hay fever before, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When was that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think that was like more than three years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, any recent surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just take some Tylenol sometimes for the like Tylenol cold, sometimes for the symptoms. I don't think it has really helped.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK, do you have any allergies? Not just to medications, but to anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh just like hay fever but nothing, nothing else that I can think of, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um, are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: As far as I know, yeah everything's up to date.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, don't think so. My sister, I think she they were saying she might have asthma and she also has eczema. No one else in the family has any other conditions.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Not not even like heart conditions, cancer?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, uh no, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, have you been in contact with anyone who's been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, and any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been here in Ontario.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I currently live in London, but I just recently moved into a new flat around two months ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Two months ago, OK. Um, is it more is it an older flat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, it's fairly new. But one thing I did notice, I don't know if this has anything to do with it, but my flatmate actually smokes. Sometimes that can really irritate and make me cough more sometimes at night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, any any pets?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, I don't have any pets.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't smoke, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, never tried marijuana.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't smoke marijuana or cigarettes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about alcohol? Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, just like, maybe sometimes at parties, but very rarely. Maybe I would say once a month.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um, and is there anything that you wanted to discuss today that I missed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, so no, I think that that was all like just the shortness of breath was scaring me a lot. But yeah, just the coughing, but other than that I just want to know what's going on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, and you mentioned you are otherwise healthy so you don't have any history of asthma or anything like that, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no ones ever told me that, but my sister has asthma, so I was wondering, maybe?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, have you ever experienced shortness of breath when you were younger with like exercise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, not really. Just maybe like the normal amount. Like if I'm running around too much, I feel shortness of breath, but I think it just got worse over the last few months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and then have you ever had any imaging done in the past like a chest X-Ray or investigations like a pulmonary function test?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't recall having any of that done.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK alright well those are all the questions I had for you. If you didn't have anything else to add, I guess we will conclude by saying that what you have, we have a differential diagnosis for this. Um, it sounds like what you have is asthma. Since your symptoms started three months ago when you moved into a flat with your friends, and it seems like this smoking and cold is triggering that and so we'll work you up with a pulmonary function test to start and we'll see if bronchodilators will help with your symptoms. And if it doesn't, we'll also rule out other things like pneumonia or like allergic rhinitis. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sounds great. Well, we'll see you soon then.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Take care.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
